did.unittitle: Ray F. Dawson collection relating to Percy Julian and the Empresa Agroquimica Guatemalteca project

bioghist.p: Ray F. Dawson (b. 1911) was a professor of Botany on the Graduate Faculty of Columbia University. He studied organic chemistry at DePauw University under Percy Lavon Julian (1899-1975).

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of correspondence between Ray Dawson, Percy Julian, and others, in connection with Julian's Empresa Agroquimica Guatemalteca, S.A. Julian and Dawson worked together during the late 1950s and 1960s to establish a facility in Guatemala for the production of raw materials for the extraction of diosgenin, a steroid intermediate. In addition to the correspondence, the collection includes reports, budgets, and permit applications. This collection is a virtually complete record of the first years of the project up to its sale to the Fine Chemicals Division of the Upjohn Company of Kalamazoo, Michigan. Also included in this collection are a typed summary of the project with a information on the correspondents, a photocopy of an article entitled "Diosgenin Production in North America" (HortTechnology, 1991), and additional letters between Julian and Dawson written in the 1960s.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
